    The re-imagined, fully updated Linea Mini from La Marzocco is a classic espresso machine that has stood the test of time as one of the most reliable home espresso machines on the market. The upgraded Line Mini features a large, 3 liter steam boiler, and a group cap that has been adopted from La Marzocco’s commercial espresso machines. It comes in a variety of colors that make it the focal point of any home espresso bar or low-volume commercial environment.

    The newest iteration of the Linea Mini draws on the heritage of the Linea Classic S commercial espresso machine, incorporating updated, Della Pietra curves and aesthetics. Also new to the Linea Mini are the Soft Touch components found on the semi-automatic paddle, steam knob, and hot water knob. Another update to the Linea Mini is the integrated shot timer, found just above the paddle to assist in pulling precise shots of espresso each time the machine is used. 

    One of the most exciting updates to the Linea Mini is the new, two-valve, soft saturation pre-infusion feature with a self-cleaning flow restrictor. When plumbed in, you can use the La Marzocco Home app to set your desired parameters to experiment with different recipes for the perfect extraction. If the Linea Mini isn’t plumbed in, try using the pre-brew feature to explore similar options. La Marzocco has also built the new Linea Mini with the Brew-By-Weight scale in mind, allowing you to program your machine to stop at your desired espresso yield for unparalleled consistency.

    La Marzocco Linea Mini Features

    • Dual boilers and PID control for consistent temperatures
    • Easily adjustable pump pressure for tailored espresso extraction
    • Integrated shot timer for precise espresso monitoring
    • Two valve pre-infusion system for soft saturation and self-cleaning
    • Brew-By-Weight scale compatibility
    • Soft Touch components enhances the tactile experience
    • Cool Touch steam wand with PEEK polymer tip
    • Automatic backflushing and customizable standby for maintenance
    • Self-cleaning flow restrictor
    • Manual paddle interface with electronic pre-infusion
    • Commercial-grade group cap for professional performance
    • Dedicated barista lights for precision and aesthetic
    • La Marzocco Home app integration

    What's Included

    • Portafilter Baskets: 7g, 14g, 17g, 21g, Cleaning Basket
    • Standard European La Marzocco Convex Tamper
    • Installation Guide / User Guide
    • Convertible Portafilter
    • Stainless Steel Steam Wand Tip
    • La Marzocco 12 oz Steaming Pitcher
    • Puro Caf Cleaning Solution

    Frequently Asked Questions

    • Who is the Linea Mini for?
      • Home espresso enthusiast, small cafes, mobile carts, and any other mobile coffee operation are all served valiantly by the Linea Mini every day in thousands of locations across the USA.
    • Can it steam milk and brew espresso at the same time?
      • Absolutely! As a independent, dual boiler espresso machine, it is very capable of doing both at the same time with ease.
    • How does it compare to other machines in this category?
      • While it doesn't win strictly on "features" it is still a super durable option that's easy to use, maintain, and will perform in higher volumes that you would expect. It's a commercial ready machine, that happens to be in a home espresso machine shell.
    • How long will this machine last?
      • As long as proper water filtration is maintained and preventative maintenance is performed, we would expect around 7-10 years of life.
    • What's the next level up in the La Marzocco Home range?
      • The GS3 AV (auto volumetric) or GS3 MP (manual paddle) are the next in line in the La Marzocco Home range. Both of these have an improved feature set and are capable of higher volume than the Linea Mini.

    Technical Details 

    • Dimensions: 15”(H) x 14”(W) x 18”(D)
    • Weight: 66 lbs
    • Group/Portafilter Size: 58mm
    • Steam Boiler Capacity: 3 liters
    • Brew Boiler Capacity: 0.17 liters
    • Water Reservoir Capacity: 2.5 liters
    • Volts: 115
    • Watts: 1620
    • Amps: 14
    • Plug Type (NEMA): Standard 15 Amp
    • Reservoir (standard): The reservoir is the water tank an espresso machine pulls water from to fill its boilers. Having a reservoir means a machine can be more portable and work in homes where plumbing isn't an option
    • Direct Plumb: Direct plumbing means you can hook your La Marzocco Linea Mini machine directly to a water line and never have to worry about refilling your reservoir again. These machines also allow you to connect the drip tray to a drain so you don't have to make that tightrope walk to the sink. Plumb In Kit sold separately

    La Marzocco Linea Mini Espresso Machine White
    We bought this machine in the middle of the COVID work-from-home situation. It has totally lived up to our expectations. We were moving from a Jura fully automatic machine to the Mini to have more control over the shot and most importantly the milk frothing. We really missed that authentic coffee shop richness and this machine hasn't disappointed us yet. We initially had a minor issue with the machine and the company dispaced a tech the same week who then ran a full diagnostics, replaced a part "just to be safe" and gave us a quick tutorial on the machine while he was there. That's the service you would expect for the price and that's what you get.

    Verified Customer
    Ales L
    La Marzocco Linea Mini Espresso Machine Black
    This machine is producing excellent espresso and cappuccino. The WiFi control was easy to install and use (while app functionality is unfortunately limited so some basics, I will prefer if I can set and read brewing water temperature instead of rotating wheel). The Line Mini is heavy duty, and has nice design. It is little large for small kitchen (but it fits under cabinet). The controls are a little crazy: temperature adjustment wheel has 80 steps, no reference point (only option is to count forty steps to be for example in the middle of the range), they are are number like 188.6 F, 192.2 (if you are wondering why 192.2 F = 89 Celsius; 188.6 F = 87 Celsius; La Marzocco engineers thought that this is good enough for american folks). If you wonder: left pressure meter is for steam temperature and control ventil is on right side - easy to figure out; The pressure meter do not have any green part where pressure is OK, but you can find this information in the user guide. These details puts smile on your face, you know it is not designed by Apple...
